blog.name: sandysreviews
blog.title: Sandy's Reviews
blog.description: Sandy - 27 - I have a deep love for movies and enjoy writing reviews - so welcome to my page and please enjoy!

summary: THREE QUICK MOVIE REVIEWS: Aladdin, Dumbo, and Detective Pikachu
title: THREE QUICK MOVIE REVIEWS: Aladdin, Dumbo, and Detective Pikachu
body:
This post includes Aladdin, Dumbo, and Detective Pikachu.

Aladdin: I absolutely adore the animated Aladdin from 1992, I was one years old when the movie came out so I grew up watching it endlessly. I was quite attached to the story and characters so when this was announced I was a huge mix of excited and nervousness. From the first trailer I wasn’t very impressed, but as the following trailers came out it slowly begun to win me over and excitement took over. The day before I saw the film, I kept seeing reviews of the movie that weren’t promising so I was expecting to be disappointed and I am so relieved that I was wrong. I really enjoyed the movie, the performances and the slight changes they decided to make. I absolutely adored Will Smith as the genie, and while I didn’t think Robin Williams could be replaced – Will Smith put his own twist to it, without taking anything away from Williams. Will Smith was also an incredible singer in the film and I am blown away by his rendition of Arabian Nights.

It honestly took me some time to warm up to Mena Massoud as Aladdin but his chemistry with Naomi Scott and Will Smith was the icing on the cake that won me over. Naomi Scott was destined to be the live action version of Jasmine and she was incredible – the performance of Speechless was amazing. I really enjoyed Aladdin and I am so relieved that it didn’t let me down. If you haven’t given the film a chance I highly recommend that you do – it deserves it.


Dumbo: I honestly don’t remember too much of the animated Dumbo, but I was excited to see this film regardless because Dumbo looked super cute and I love Colin Farrell. The storyline for the film was pretty decent, and the introduction/development and conclusion to Dumbo’s story is a good one. It’s feel good and emotional and its suitable for children and adults to enjoy. I wasn’t completely blown away by any of the performances, there is a lot of actors and actresses in the movie that I love, but this is nowhere close to being one of their best movies so the performances are honestly pretty forgettable.

I enjoyed the movie enough to see it once, so I do recommend watching it – but I don’t believe it has much rewatch value.


Pokémon Detective Pikachu: I grew up with Pokémon, and Pikachu was by far my favourite so I was excited to see a talking Pikachu movie! And voiced by Ryan Reynolds – what’s even better?!?! I didn’t need much convincing to the see film, and I really enjoyed the insane introduction of the majority of the Pokémon. Overall I expected a little bit more from the story, but I wasn’t sure exactly what was missing that I expected – if that at all makes sense? I was just expecting “more”. I enjoyed the performances, but I thought there would be more in the character development and there wouldn’t be a convoluted story plot that would cause a lot of holes in the conclusion. 

As a film it was enjoyable if you don’t take it seriously or read too much into the plot holes, but there is no denying it’s definitely not perfect. Pokémon fans should check it out!

blog.name: rachelshneyer
blog.title: Rachel Shneyer Illustration + Design
blog.description: the art tumblr of illustrator and designer Rachel Shneyer.

summary: I didn't plan ahead too well for sketchmeet last night and forgot to charge up my iPad and also didn't bring many art supplies...
body:
I didn’t plan ahead too well for sketchmeet last night and forgot to charge up my iPad and also didn’t bring many art supplies along. I did end up doing a limited palette Detective Pikachu with what I did have: black, red, and yellow pens, and a mechanical pencil. I think he turned out pretty cute.

Speaking of Detective Pikachu, the movie was pretty fun. I went in with no expectations and really enjoyed how they portrayed Rhyme City - it felt very alive and the Pokémon were well integrated.

Microns and zebra pen in sketchbook.

tags: i can hear it so clearly in my mind
summary:
Two things:
I desperately want to know how the "Wanna be Pikachu?" conversation went with Ryan Reynolds.
I also want to step...
body:
Two things:

  1. I desperately want to know how the “Wanna be Pikachu?” conversation went with Ryan Reynolds.
  2. I also want to step into the alternate dimension where DeVito!Pikachu exists, just to see what that would have been like.

summary: person from english speaking country: "OMG you need to see __(animated movie)__ because __(character in that movie__ is voiced...
body:
person from english speaking country: “OMG you need to see __(animated movie)__ because __(character in that movie__ is voiced by __(cool actor you love)__”

you, a person from a country where they voice the characters in your native language: *misses the only two dates when this movie is shown in english* *doesnt even live in a big city so the movie is never shown in its original language ever*
